channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2024070074
item.description:
Report I-2024070074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-13T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: West Plains
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VERNON WILSON TRUCKING INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 5,2024, a Vernon Wilson Trucking tractor trailer was involved in a motor vehicle accident that resulted in a diesel fuel, motor, oil, and hazardous, UN1942 Ammonium Nitrate, 5.1, PG Ill release. To the roadway and soils. Approximately 100-200 gallons of diesel fuel and oil and approximately 5 tons of Ammonium Nitrate released to the soil. The Fire Department washed the diesel fuel and oil off the road to get traffic opened up. EWI indicated that there was 60' x 60' area of soil impacted by the cargo and a 60' x 150' area of the roadway impacted. EWI personnel applied absorbent materials to the roadway and will have to return to excavate the site. EWI personnel excavated the area and stockpiled it off the side of the roadway. On June 6,2024, EWI personnel returned to the site to finish the excavation. EWI personnel utilized heavy equipment to excavate the impacted soil approximately 1-2 feet in depth. Once the impacted material was removed, EWI personnel backfilled the area, spread to grade, and applied seed and straw. EWI generated(1) roll off approximately 6 tons of petroleum impacted soil and absorbents and(1) roll off approximately 8 tons of cargo and soil for waste.

item.title: Report E-2024080126
item.description:
Report E-2024080126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: WOONSOCKET
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EQ NORTHEAST, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Material was picked up at shipper's location in morning, no evidence of any leak at that time. At 2nd stop of the day driver conducted regular inspection of lading and noticed small amount of liquid atop IBC, not leaking to floor of truck. Driver took precaution of tightening ring bolt further. At 3rd and final stop of this day no evidence of further leaking. Immediately after this incident we reached out to IBC manufacturer to inquire about different gaskets that may be better suited for package/lading. They sent a representative to our facility on 6/20/24 and it was determined the gaskets were appropriate for shipment. What was discovered was that manufacturer's original closure instructions has been changed since purchase of this container. Original instructions were 30 ft/lbs torque on closures. This was updated after the fact to 40 ft/lbs. We had a subsequent and very similar leak on 6/4/24 (before manufacturer rep arrived and updated instructions), see previous report on this event.
